Very solid shooter game. Feels very satisfying to shoot people, the gun sounds are nice and the mechanics and hitboxes are (most of the time) solid. The only bad things are the anti-cheat system and the aiming jank that occurs in basically every weapon but those are pretty minor things compared to the good sides of CS:GO. Pretty nice game.

Karen Approved
There’s really nothing on this game that your kid hasn’t seen in movies or television. The point of it is to fight against terrorists and work as a team. My son who is 11 plays this game and I see no more aggression or rudeness or anything come out of him when he plays the game or after he plays the game, I thought that the game was all about guns and killing people but it’s just a healthy outlet for aggression and the violence doesn’t carry out of the game at all (with my son at least). I got the game for my son because he wanted to play it with his friends and I think playing this game with his friends made them closer. He gets out of the house a lot too with his friends and only spends some of his free time playing video games. I approve of this game because he seems to enjoy it and it has no negative effect on him or any of the kids that I know that play it too and it’s all about strategy and competition and has nothing in the game that the kids haven’t already seen on tv.
